content.title: One Time Assistance to Small and Marginal Farmers for Purchase of Small Farm Implements (OTA-SFI)
content.department: Agriculture Department, Government of West Bengal
content.details: One Time Assistance to Small and Marginal Farmers for Purchase of Small Farm Implements (OTA-SFI) under the Farm Mechanization Umbrella Scheme, was launched on 12 February, 2013 by the Agriculture Department, Government of West Bengal with the purpose to aid the farmers in procuring manually operated small farm implements necessary for agricultural operations. Financial support will be provided mostly for manually operated tools like sprayer, manually operated paddy thresher, cono weeder, weeder, drum-seeder, solar light trap, chaff cutter, seed bin, seed tray, seeder etc. and battery operated sprayers and PVC pipes for carrying water etc. under OTA-SFI. The scheme is applicable uniformly throughout the State, except Kolkata district.
benefits: Maximum â‚¹10,000/- or 50% of total indicative price of purchased manually operated machinery/implement whichever is lower.
eligibility: Individual farmers registered under Krishak Bandhu (New) Scheme.
Groups like SKUS/PACS/FPO/FPC/FIG/SHG duly graded /LAMPS etc approved/recognized by any Govt Institution/Departments.
The age of the beneficiary should be minimum 18 years at the time of application.
exclusions: A beneficiary or his/her spouse will not be eligible to apply afresh before completion of 4(four) years from release last subsidy for any type of machinery under any Farm Mechanization scheme.

An employee/retired employee of State Government, Statutory Bodies, Government Undertakings, Panchayats, Municipal Corporations/ Municipalities, Local Bodies, Government Aided Educational Institutions etc. is not eligible.
content.application_process: Online. Visit the official FMS portal and follow the registration and application process as detailed in the scheme.
documents_required: Aadhar of Applicant & Spouse for individual application
Name of manufacturer etc. to be selected from the Departmental Portal.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to aid the farmers in procuring manually operated small farm implements necessary for agricultural operations.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department Of Agriculture, Government of West Bengal has launched this scheme.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Individual farmers registered under Krishak Bandhu (Natun) Scheme or groups approved/recognized by any Govt Institution/Departments.

faqs.question: How to avail the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers can apply online in Matirkatha/FMS portal after due advertisement in leading dailies.

faqs.question: Is there any fee or charges to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no charges to apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: How will the subsidy be released to the beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The subsidy will be released to the bank A/C of the respective beneficiaries through DBT mode.
